    • Constructor Detail

      • Application

        public Application()

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
        Initializer for the Java Applet. First it adds a functionality for the mouse so it can be used to play the game. Then it prompts an input box for the players to insert their names, and creates these Player objects for the current game. Finally, it starts a new game.
        Overrides:
        init in class java.applet.Applet

      • startGame

        public void startGame()
        Function which starts a new game, but switches the Player objects so the two players take turns on being the first player.

      • mousePressed

        public void mousePressed(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        Function which determines the actions when a mouse clicks on the game board. Here is also implemented the messages players get when a game finishes, and asks the players whether they want to play another game in the end, which is triggered when the mouse has clicked on the last field available or the field that results in a win for the player.
        Specified by:
        mousePressed in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener
        Parameters:
        e - Determines the MouseEvent the mouse triggers.

      • paint

        public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Function which handles the graphics of the game board and the symbols players put on it.
        Overrides:
        paint in class java.awt.Container
        Parameters:
        g - The Graphics object which creates the graphics for the Game.

      • mouseReleased

        public void mouseReleased(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        These functions implement the actions of the mouse.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        e - The event which the mouse triggers.
